messageBody:
re - assert counting

As I said before, I would just want a warning when a test method is empty or has no asserts... but I don't want to go to the trouble of getting some code-coverage tool working.

> I think Jeff has hit the nail on the head, I too would like to be
> able to get some feedback when the number of asserts has changed
> for the same reasons.
>
> Seems to me that the simplest thing that could possibly work is
> to count the asserts.

I'm not using the current JUnit, since my old version is doing just fine, with no class-loader problems because it doesn't do its own class-loading, and I've customized it to write time-per-test information to stdout, etc... Eventually I will add the no-asserts warning to my versions of CppUnit and JUnit.

Does the current JUnit have a tree view of test-cases within test-suites within other test-suites? If it did, then the lowest-level view of a single test-case could display the assert count, or perhaps turn some color if there were no asserts.

Did the code that someone wrote to look for TestCase subclasses in specified directory hierarchies or jar files, and automatically run them, get put into JUnit or made public?
